intro: Alyxia oleifolia var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central corolla. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in scrublands and dry woodlands.
